input.description: adapter name [Optional] The name of the adapter that is enabled on the Peer. The default adapter name is MOM2005Adapter

items The items XML that will be used to release from an user Sample:
<items> <operation-parameter> <search-parameters> <alert-id>f76fc97f-3172-4aa8-acb3-3f57a7fb40a1</alert-id> </search-parameters> </operation-parameter> </items>
Description of fields that can come in search-parameters xml:-
alert-id [Optional] The guid of the alert used to identify the alert. component [Optional] The name of the component or feature within the application that caused the alert. component-instance [Optional] The name of a particular instance of the component or feature within the application that caused the alert. computer-domain [Optional] Domain to which the computer belongs. computer-name [Optional] The name of the computer. custom-field-1 [Optional] The first user-defined field. custom-field-2 [Optional] The second user-defined field. custom-field-3 [Optional] The third user-defined field. custom-field-4 [Optional] The fourth user-defined field. custom-field-5 [Optional] The fifth user-defined field. description [Optional] The alert description. name [Optional] The name of the alert. owner-name [Optional] The account name that owns the alert. problem-state [Optional] The values that specify the current state. resolution-state [Optional] The state of the alert. server-role [Optional] The role of the computer. server-role-instance [Optional] The name of the instance of the role. severity [Optional] The severity of the alert. source [Optional] The name of the Windows service that was the source of the alert. time-raised [Optional] The time when the alert was raised. url [Optional] Hyperlink to the alert's page in the MOM Web console repeat-count [Optional] For consolidated events, the RepeatCount field gets the number of repeat occurrences. time-added [Optional] The time when the alert was added to the MOM database last-time-state-modified [Optional] The time when the alert's state last changed time-last-modified [Optional] The time when the alert's state or properties last changed ticket-id [Optional] Stores the id identifying a trouble ticket associated with this alert modified-by [Optional] The last user to change the alert's properties. time-of-first-event [Optional] The time when the first event was raised time-of-last-event [Optional] The time when the first event was raised resolved-by [Optional] The name of the user account responsible for resolving the alert, if it has been resolved comment [Optional] Comment in the history log acknowledge [Optional] Set to "true" if alerts need to be acknowledged which match the specified alert-id, else set to "false"

documentation.description:
Releases the alert from the current user.
Sample input XML:
<items> <operation-parameter> <search-parameters> <alert-id>f76fc97f-3172-4aa8-acb3-3f57a7fb40a1</alert-id> </search-parameters> </operation-parameter> </items>
